abstracts.cdata!:
The Hubei Shiman Highway Project entails
            extensive construction works, in particular, the
            construction of the Shiman expressway, aimed at promoting an
            integrated development for sustainable transportation
            systems within the north-western Hubei Province. This
            resettlement action plan (Volume 1) and policy framework
            (volume 2), sets the standards to minimize relocation, and
            social impacts that will occur as a result of land
            acquisition, based on the country's legal framework,
            and the Bank's policy requirements regarding
            resettlement. Displaced persons losing agricultural land,
            will be entitled to reallocation compensation, and to
            benefit from collective investment of land compensation.
            Wherever land reallocation is not possible, displaced
            persons shall be provided with employment wages, at minimum
            equal to income lost, or, may be paid a resettlement
            subsidy, equivalent to at least six times the average annual
            production output value of the land in the previous three
            years. Should this not be sufficient to restore livelihoods,
            the subsidy may be raised to as much as fourteen times the
            average annual output value. Provided land compensation, and
            resettlement subsidies paid are still insufficient,
            resettlement subsidies may be further increased upon
            approval by the municipal government. Displaced persons
            whose land in temporarily taken to facilitate construction
            works, will be compensated for their income losses, crop
            losses, and for the cost of soil restoration, and damaged
            infrastructures. Housing and structural losses will be
            compensated through the provision of replacement housing of
            equivalent value, at full replacement cost, and/or
            replacement or restoration of facilities, and services.
            Moving expenses will be provided, and, special measures, or
            preferential treatment will enable the poor and vulnerable
            households to replacement housing that meets minimum
            community standards. Business, or employment losses will be
            compensated through alternative business sites, cash
            compensation, and transitional payment for moving expenses,
            and loss of sales or income, while alternative employment at
            equivalent wages will be provided, or, cash settlement
            equivalent to at least three years of lost wages. A
            transitional payment for re-training, relocation or other
            measures, will be provided. Grievance mechanisms will be in
            place, should conflict occur.
